meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: The question here is, why do liars who lie in the course of running for office get, at worst, a slap on the wrist, when lying lands you in jail if you do it to a jury. We shouldn’t want liars in charge of government, should we?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/N1SD6Q&via=Digg&text=Why We Let Politicians Lie

li.div: curious as to what it would be like to stand on mars? panoramas.dk/mars/curiosit...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RuzZVK&via=Digg&text=This Latest Mars Panorama Will Blow Your Mind

div.div: There’s one shop in India that local Jews won’t stop by at any price: the one called “Hitler”.

li.div: We "only recently read about Hitler on the internet,” says owner of just-opened "Hitler" store in India. O_o rt.com/art-and-culture/news/hi...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OtmAJs&via=Digg&text='Hitler' Clothing Store Opens In India

div.a: Your Facebook Account Visualized Thanks To Wolfram Alpha

div.div: Wolfram Alpha is giving you a crazy-detailed visualization of your Facebook account.

li.div: Oh man. Get ready to have your afternoon destroyed by a deep dive into personal analytics results. Super cool. blog.wolframalpha.com/2012/08/...

div.a: Why You Should Leave The Stock Market To The Pros

div.div: Just in time for your Labor Day vacation, the Securities and Exchange Commission has produced a spellbinding story of what happens when normal people try to invest like Wall Street big shots.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PQHtSL&via=Digg&text=Why You Should Leave The Stock Market To The Pros

div.div: Hedge funds may go from soliciting individual investors behind closed doors to conducting wide advertising campaigns under a rule proposed today by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RmS6sE&via=Digg&text=Coming Soon: Hedge-Fund Advertising

div.div: SEE NO EVIL, HEAR NO EVIL
Chimps won't punish transgressions unless they were the victim.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TzIOLL&via=Digg&text=Chimpanzee-Style Crime And Punishment

div.a: HBO Cuts The Cord For International Launch

div.div: HBO will make the Nordic region the first market where its programming will be available to consumers without requiring that they have a pay-TV subscription.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PT4CRZ&via=Digg&text=HBO Cuts The Cord For International Launch

div.div: Simulation could finally solve the 'lunar paradox' that has baffled scientists.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PtZ12E&via=Digg&text=Was The Moon Formed By A 'Hit And Run' Collision With Earth?

div.a: Harvard Investigates 125 Students In Massive Cheating Ring

div.div: About 125 Harvard University undergraduates are being investigated for cheating on a final exam earlier this year, the most widespread academic misconduct scandal known at the school.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PuLYz8&via=Digg&text=Harvard Investigates 125 Students In Massive Cheating Ring

div.a: Microsoft Brings Pong, Asteroids And Other Classic Atari Games To Your Browser

div.div: Microsoft is brining a slew of classic Atari games to your browser. Say goodbye to productivity.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q4Mq9O&via=Digg&text=Microsoft Brings Pong, Asteroids And Other Classic Atari Games To Your Browser

div.div: Once the heroes of nations, pirates went from being state-sponsored champions to tolerated annoyances to the basest sort of criminals. What changed?

li.div: "Capitalists accumulate. Pirates archive." A pro-piracy proponent explains the subversion of intellectual property. jacobinmag.com/2012/08/gimme-t...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PP1Tcc&via=Digg&text=The Changing Connotation Of 'Piracy'

div.a: Does A Calorie-Restricting Diet Really Work?

div.div: A major new study says what you eat may matter more than how much you eat.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RsRGVQ&via=Digg&text=Does A Calorie-Restricting Diet Really Work?

div.div: YOU'VE GOT SOME SH*T ON YOUR FACE

div.a: Rosacea May Be Caused By Mite Feces In Your Pores

div.div: There are tiny bugs closely related to spiders living in the pores of your face. They have long been considered mere passengers, doing no harm beyond upsetting the squeamish. But they may be causing an ancient skin disease that is estimated to affect between 5 and 20 per cent of people worldwide, and 16 million in the US alone.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/N1AFRR&via=Digg&text=Rosacea May Be Caused By Mite Feces In Your Pores

div.div: Consumers aiming to buy Amazon's current Kindle Fire are out of luck, but a new model may be just around the corner.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/O60Oft&via=Digg&text=Kindle Fire 'Sold Out'

div.a: Which States Have The Worst Air

div.div: The Natural Resources Defense Council recently published its annual "Toxic Twenty" list, ranking U.S. sates by their toxic air pollution.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OBcRnY&via=Digg&text=Which States Have The Worst Air

div.a: This Is How A Medical Scanner Looks Without Its Skin

div.div: When you look at them in hospitals, CT (Computer Tomography) scanners look like devices from Star Trek's Enterprise. When you look at them without their smooth futuristic covers on, they look like tired engine parts from the Battlestar Galactica.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RuWBFL&via=Digg&text=This Is How A Medical Scanner Looks Without Its Skin

div.div: In celebration of the 50th anniversary of Warhol’s classic “Campbell’s Soup Cans,” Campbell’s is bringing out a line of tomato soup cans that are reminiscent of Warhol’s style and include quotes by him.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SV5lXp&via=Digg&text=Campbell's To Introduce Warhol-Inspired Cans

div.div: An aggressive donkey is being blamed for the death of Hollywood Park Mayor William “Bill” Bohlke.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RqvjfK&via=Digg&text=Mayor Killed By Donkey

div.a: How Many Cord Nevers Are There?

div.div: There's this idea that young people, who have grown up in a streaming Internet world, aren't getting cable and they never will.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q1oPXI&via=Digg&text=How Many Cord Nevers Are There?

div.a: A Kinetic Sculptural Tour Of San Francisco

div.div: Scott Weaver took 100k toothpicks and 35 years to create this insanely complex kinetic structure, "Rolling through the Bay."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/f2Xege&via=Digg&text=A Kinetic Sculptural Tour Of San Francisco

div.a: Apple Rejects App That Tracks U.S. Drone Strikes

div.div: It seemed like a simple enough idea for an iPhone app: Send users a pop-up notice whenever a flying robots kills someone in one of America’s many undeclared wars. But Apple keeps blocking the Drones+ program from its App Store — and therefore, from iPhones everywhere.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TxwYlm&via=Digg&text=Apple Rejects App That Tracks U.S. Drone Strikes

div.div: Apple geniuses are now available for online help to customers in the UK, Germany, Spain and Brazil.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/O29mnA&via=Digg&text=Apple Geniuses Now Available Online
